title: Add and Subtract
question_text: Every day, a beetle climbs 4 cm up a window before slipping 2.5 cm down again. How far up the window will the beetle climb after 30 days?
What is the difference between the largest and smallest 5-digit numbers that can be made by rearranging all five of these digits? 7 8 3 2 9
Pencils costs 7 p each and exercise books cost 17 p each. Simon buys 4 pencils and 3 exercise books. He pays with a £5 note. How much change does Simon receive?
A bakery sells 17 loaves of bread and 13 cookies per day. How many more loaves of bread than cookies does the bakery sell in a fortnight?

Ann, Ben, Chris and Dana all read books during the summer holidays. Ann read twice as many books as Ben. Dana read 5 books more than Chris but 6 books less than Ann. Chris read 5 books. How many books did they read altogether?
Two magazines and one pencil cost £2. One board game and one book cost £4. Two pencil cases and one magazine cost £7.50. What is the total cost of one magazine, one pencil and one pencil case?
Every day, a spider climbs 7 cm up a window before slipping 4.5 cm down again. How far up the window will the spider climb after 40 days?
What is the difference between the largest and smallest 5-digit numbers that can be made by rearranging all five of these digits? 6 4 5 1 8
A tuck shop sells 22 snickers and 17 dairy milks per day. How many more snickers than dairy milks does the tuck shop sell in a 3 weeks?
